title: Twitter Offers Advertisers Generous Incentives, After Many Marketers Left Platform
description: Twitter is offering advertisers incentives to increase their spending on the platform, an effort to jump-start its business after Elon Musk’s takeover prompted many companies to pull back.

title: Salesforce Isn't on Cloud Nine
description: Marc Benioff, the co-founder and longtime chief of Salesforce, is bidding farewell to the second person with whom he has attempted to share the top job.

title: Tesla Set to Deliver Semi Truck to PepsiCo
description: Elon Musk’s car company is expanding beyond passenger vehicles with the delivery of its first all-electric semitrailer five years after introducing the model.

title: China Clamps Down on Internet as It Seeks to Stamp Out Covid Protests
description: The country’s online regulators tell big tech companies to expand censorship of information on protests and take steps to curb the virtual private networks used to bypass online controls.

title: Netflix to Let Tens of Thousands of Subscribers Preview Content
description: The streaming giant plans a global expansion of the program that helped make “Don’t Look Up” less serious.

title: Rising Tether Loans Add Risk to Stablecoin, Crypto
description: Tether reports hadn’t disclosed that loans it issues are denominated and payable in the token. The rise in Tether’s lending add risk to the crypto world.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried Denies Knowing Scale of Bad Alameda Bets
description: Sam Bankman-Fried said that he didn’t intend to commit any fraud or use customer funds to back leveraged bets that went wrong at Alameda Research, a crypto hedge fund attached to FTX that pushed the exchange to bankruptcy.

title: Elon Musk Says Apple, Twitter Have 'Resolved' Differences After Meeting
description: The Twitter boss said he met with Apple CEO Tim Cook at Apple’s headquarters and that Mr. Cook said Apple never considered banning Twitter from the App Store.
